intro: Quararibea venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan quina, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in humid, lowland areas with well-drained soil. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow. Its fruits are small drupes that contain a single seed, and it plays a role in local ecosystems as a habitat for various insects and birds. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
